description: System and Services Acquisition policy and procedures documentation, including roles, responsibilities, review frequency, and approval authority
Capital planning and investment control documentation showing resource allocation for information security and privacy, including discrete line items in programming and budgeting documentation
System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) documentation that incorporates security and privacy considerations, including defined roles and responsibilities throughout the lifecycle

Acquisition contracts for systems, components, or services, including security and privacy functional requirements, assurance requirements, acceptance criteria, and Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Section 889 compliance documentation
Security configuration baseline documentation (DoD STIGs, CIS Level 2 benchmarks, or custom baselines) for all systems, components, and services
Administrator and user documentation for systems, components, and services, including secure configuration, installation, operation guidance, and known vulnerabilities
Systems security and privacy engineering principles documentation showing application throughout the specification, design, development, implementation, and modification phases
External system services agreements, service-level agreements, and continuous monitoring documentation demonstrating compliance with FedRAMP security controls baselines
Risk assessment documentation for acquisition or outsourcing of information security services, including organizational approvals
List of functions, ports, protocols, and services required for all external system services where Federal information is processed or stored

Documentation confirming that information processing, data storage, and system services are restricted to U.S./U.S. Territories or locations with U.S. jurisdiction for all High impact data, systems, or services
Developer configuration management documentation, including change control procedures, integrity verification methods, and security flaw tracking and resolution reports
Developer security and privacy assessment plans, including unit/integration/system/regression testing results, flaw remediation processes, and evidence of test execution
Static code analysis reports documenting identified flaws, remediation actions, and methodology for reviewing newly developed code (or dynamic code analysis if source code is unavailable)
Threat modeling and vulnerability analysis documentation performed during development and testing, including contextual information, tools/methods used, rigor level, and acceptance criteria
Development process documentation showing security and privacy requirements integration, standards and tools used, tool configurations, and integrity controls for process changes (reviewed annually)
Criticality analysis documentation performed at key decision points in the SDLC, including breadth and depth of analysis for high value assets
Developer-provided training materials and records on the correct use and operation of implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and mechanisms
Developer security and privacy architecture and design specifications showing consistency with enterprise architecture, allocation of controls, and unified approach to protection
Developer personnel screening documentation, including access authorizations, background checks, clearances, and list of individuals authorized to perform development activities
Inventory of system components with support status, including replacement plans for unsupported components or documentation of alternative support arrangements (in-house or external providers)
